verses.roman:
tadā rāmaś ca kṛṣṇaś ca
svaiḥ svair bandhubhir anvitau
rejatuḥ sva-sutair dārair
jīveśau sva-vibhūtibhiḥ

synonyms: tadā—at that time; rāmaḥ—Lord Balarāma; ca—and; kṛṣṇaḥ—Lord Kṛṣṇa; ca—also; svaiḥ svaiḥ—each by His own; bandhubhiḥ—relatives; anvitau—accompanied; rejatuḥ—appeared brilliant; sva—with His own; sutaiḥ—sons; dāraiḥ—and wives; jīva—of all living entities; īśau—the two Lords; sva-vibhūtibhiḥ—with the expansions of Their own opulences.
translation: At that time Balarāma and Kṛṣṇa, the Lords of all living entities, shone forth with great majesty in the company of Their respective sons, wives and other family members, who were expansions of Their opulences.
